channel.title: Posts on Tanner Malinowski | Sports Data Analysis
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Tanner Malinowski | Sports Data Analysis

item.title: What Defines a Kevin Willard Team?
item.description: After spending more than ten seasons as Seton Hall’s head coach, Kevin Willard became Maryland’s new head man before the 2022-23 season. Willard had a successful tenure with the Pirates, reviving the program after a futile stretch under Bobby Gonzalez. Willard’s Seton Hall squads were known for their defense, so I wanted to explore just what defensive categories they especially excelled in under Willard. I did this by taking Seton Hall’s per-game averages from the 2011-12 through 2021-22 seasons and comparing them to Maryland’s – along with the rest of the NCAA’s averages during that time frame.

item.title: Are College Football Teams Passing More on First Down?
item.description: Are college football teams passing more on first down this season compared to past seasons? The number of college football teams have fluctauted over the past years, so it’s best to caluculate this as a percentage. We’ll need to first find how many total plays have been run on first down, then find how many of those have been passing plays. From there, we’ll divide the number of first down passing plays for each season by the total number of first down plays for each season and multiply it by 100 to get a whole number percentage.

item.title: NFL Red Zone EPA
item.description: library(tidyverse) ## ── Attaching packages ─────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse 1.3.2 ── ## ✔ ggplot2 3.3.6 ✔ purrr 0.3.4 ## ✔ tibble 3.1.8 ✔ dplyr 1.0.9 ## ✔ tidyr 1.2.0 ✔ stringr 1.4.1 ## ✔ readr 2.1.2 ✔ forcats 0.5.1 ## ── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ── ## ✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter() ## ✖ dplyr::lag() masks stats::lag() library(nflreadr) library(ggalt) ## Registered S3 methods overwritten by 'ggalt': ## method from ## grid.draw.absoluteGrob ggplot2 ## grobHeight.absoluteGrob ggplot2 ## grobWidth.

item.title: Volleyball Aces Beeswarm
item.description: library(tidyverse) ## ── Attaching packages ─────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse 1.3.2 ── ## ✔ ggplot2 3.3.6 ✔ purrr 0.3.4 ## ✔ tibble 3.1.8 ✔ dplyr 1.0.9 ## ✔ tidyr 1.2.0 ✔ stringr 1.4.1 ## ✔ readr 2.1.2 ✔ forcats 0.5.1 ## ── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ── ## ✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter() ## ✖ dplyr::lag() masks stats::lag() library(ggbeeswarm) library(ggrepel) set.seed(1234) aces <- read_csv('https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dwillis/NCAAWomensVolleyballData/main/data/ncaa_womens_volleyball_playerstats_2022.csv') ## Rows: 5379 Columns: 32 ## ── Column specification ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────── ## Delimiter: "," ## chr (7): team, full_name, roster_name, last_name, first_name, yr, pos ## dbl (23): season, jersey, feet, inches, gp, gs, mp, s, kills, errors, total_.

item.title: Maryland Football YPP
item.description: library(tidyverse) ## ── Attaching packages ─────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse 1.3.2 ── ## ✔ ggplot2 3.3.6 ✔ purrr 0.3.4 ## ✔ tibble 3.1.8 ✔ dplyr 1.0.9 ## ✔ tidyr 1.2.0 ✔ stringr 1.4.1 ## ✔ readr 2.1.2 ✔ forcats 0.5.1 ## ── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ── ## ✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter() ## ✖ dplyr::lag() masks stats::lag() library(ggrepel) Loading college football data spanning from 2011 to today. ypp <- read_csv('https://dwillis.github.io/sports-data-files/footballlogs1122.csv') ## Rows: 18050 Columns: 57 ## ── Column specification ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────── ## Delimiter: "," ## chr (9): HomeAway, Opponent, Result, TeamFull, TeamURL, Outcome, Team, Con.

item.title: Recruiting Rankings and Wins
item.description: library(tidyverse) ## ── Attaching packages ─────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse 1.3.2 ── ## ✔ ggplot2 3.3.6 ✔ purrr 0.3.4 ## ✔ tibble 3.1.8 ✔ dplyr 1.0.9 ## ✔ tidyr 1.2.0 ✔ stringr 1.4.1 ## ✔ readr 2.1.2 ✔ forcats 0.5.1 ## ── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ── ## ✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter() ## ✖ dplyr::lag() masks stats::lag() records <- read_csv('https://dwillis.github.io/sports-data-files/all_teams.csv') ## Rows: 904 Columns: 21 ## ── Column specification ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────── ## Delimiter: "," ## chr (3): team, conference, division ## dbl (18): year, expected_wins, total_games, total_wins, total_losses, total_.

item.title: First Play Interceptions
item.description: library(tidyverse) ## ── Attaching packages ─────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse 1.3.2 ── ## ✔ ggplot2 3.3.6 ✔ purrr 0.3.4 ## ✔ tibble 3.1.8 ✔ dplyr 1.0.9 ## ✔ tidyr 1.2.0 ✔ stringr 1.4.1 ## ✔ readr 2.1.2 ✔ forcats 0.5.1 ## ── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ── ## ✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter() ## ✖ dplyr::lag() masks stats::lag() library(cfbfastR) tictoc::tic() pbp <- data.frame() seasons <- 2014:cfbfastR:::most_recent_cfb_season() progressr::with_progress({ pbp <- cfbfastR::load_cfb_pbp(seasons) }) Find first plays from scrimmage in the first half - how many are there?

item.title: First Pass Interceptions
item.description: library(tidyverse) ## ── Attaching packages ─────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse 1.3.2 ── ## ✔ ggplot2 3.3.6 ✔ purrr 0.3.4 ## ✔ tibble 3.1.8 ✔ dplyr 1.0.9 ## ✔ tidyr 1.2.0 ✔ stringr 1.4.1 ## ✔ readr 2.1.2 ✔ forcats 0.5.1 ## ── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ── ## ✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter() ## ✖ dplyr::lag() masks stats::lag() library(cfbfastR) tictoc::tic() pbp <- data.frame() seasons <- 2014:cfbfastR:::most_recent_cfb_season() progressr::with_progress({ pbp <- cfbfastR::load_cfb_pbp(seasons) }) Indiana QB Connor Bazelak threw interceptions on the first offensive play of the game on Saturday.

item.title: How Does Maryland Volleyball Score Its Points in 2022?
item.description: library(tidyverse) ## ── Attaching packages ─────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse 1.3.2 ── ## ✔ ggplot2 3.3.6 ✔ purrr 0.3.4 ## ✔ tibble 3.1.8 ✔ dplyr 1.0.9 ## ✔ tidyr 1.2.0 ✔ stringr 1.4.1 ## ✔ readr 2.1.2 ✔ forcats 0.5.1 ## ── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ── ## ✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter() ## ✖ dplyr::lag() masks stats::lag() Loading 2022 volleyball data vb2022stats <- read_csv("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dwillis/NCAAWomensVolleyballData/main/data/ncaa_womens_volleyball_matchstats_2022.csv") ## Rows: 6718 Columns: 36 ## ── Column specification ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────── ## Delimiter: "," ## chr (4): team, opponent, home_away, result ## dbl (31): team_score, opponent_score, s, kills, errors, total_attacks, hit_.

item.description: This is my very first post. I hope you share it and read all my amazing analysis.

item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.98 ## 3rd Qu.

item.title: A Plain Markdown Post
item.description: This is a post written in plain Markdown (*.md) instead of R Markdown (*.Rmd). The major differences are: You cannot run any R code in a plain Markdown document, whereas in an R Markdown document, you can embed R code chunks (```{r}); A plain Markdown post is rendered through Blackfriday, and an R Markdown document is compiled by rmarkdown and Pandoc. There are many differences in syntax between Blackfriday’s Markdown and Pandoc’s Markdown.
